sols_html: We wish to maximize the revenue \(f(p,q) = pq\) subject to the constraint \(g(p,q) = p^2 + 4q^2 = 800\).

sols_raw: We wish to <b>maximize</b> the revenue <math>f(p,q) = pq</math> <b>subject to the constraint</b> <math>g(p,q) = p^2 + 4q^2 = 800</math>.
statement_html:
According to market research, the demand curve for a local pizza restaurant satisfies the following relation: if p is the price of a pizza (in dollars), and q is the number of pizzas sold per day, then

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle p^2 + 4q^2 = 800.\end{aligned}\]

The restaurant owners want to determine what price the restaurant should charge for each pizza in order to make their daily revenue as high as possible.

(a) Formulate this as a constrained optimization problem, clearly stating the objective function and the constraint.
